text.*:
The Accursed Prince

Chapter Info

Volume:

111

Chapter:

1130

Japanese Title:

呪いの王子

Romanized Title:

Noroi no Ōji

Viz Title:

The Accursed Prince

Pages:

15

Release Date:

October 21, 2024

WSJ Issue:

2024 Issue 47
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →
Chapter 1130 is titled "The Accursed Prince".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick References
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Arc Navigation

Cover Page[]

Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage, Vol. 17: "Sword got stolen during naptime"

Short Summary[]

At sea, the rest of the Straw Hat Pirates decide to call off the search for the Thousand Sunny, and head straight for Elbaph, knowing the other crew members are likely there. Meanwhile, the other crew members are exploring when they learn they are in Elbaph. While crossing a giant bridge, Luffy hears a voice and goes after it. As Franky's group learn that Hajrudin is a prince, and about the accursed prince Loki. On Elbaph, Luffy meets Loki.

Long Summary[]

On the Great Eirik, Franky tells the Giants to cease the search for Luffy’s group, as he is confident that despite them not being here, they are still alive. Robin adds that they have done all they can do for now so they should just head for Elbaph and wait for them. Jinbe agrees, stating that his shark network is exhausted from searching, and Brook reminds them that they are out of food. The Giants accept these reasons and set course for Elbaph.

Speaking of Luffy’s group, the six of them managed to escape the room, where they see a giant tree and several giant snowy mountains, with a large rope bridge connecting the castle they were just in to another location upwards. They see two giants crossing the bridge, who turn out to be Gerd and Goldberg, the respective doctor and cook of the New Giant Warrior Pirates. Gerd asks Goldberg why Hajrudin let Road into their crew, with Goldberg saying it is because he is a good navigator. Gerd, however, expresses her dislike of Road, saying that while Loki is the “Shame of Elbaph”, she thinks Road deserves that title more, with Goldberg agreeing with her.

Gerd asks her owl, Piper, if she saw Road’s crow carrying a ship to the castle, which she confirms. Goldberg says they are supposed to arrest intruders, but Road keeps smuggling them into the country, to which if they find them, they will report to Jarul. Meanwhile, Luffy’s group hides from the two, and Usopp deduces from their conversation that they have indeed reached Elbaph. Luffy prepares to call out to them but Nami stops him out of fear that they will consider them intruders. Gerd and Goldberg turn to where the crew was when they hear something but they see nothing, so they continue to the castle.

The Straw Hats continue to walk on the rope bridge, though they try to be careful because there are giant wolves below. Luffy, however, senses something that gives him goosebumps. He tells everyone he heard something back in the diorama and he decides to go on ahead to check it out.

Back out at sea, the Giant Warrior Pirates are shocked to learn that the papers are reporting them as the attackers of Egghead. In addition, Dorry and Brogy’s bounties have both jumped up to 1,800,000,000 Belly, even though the both of them do not consider themselves back. Also, Luffy is being blamed for killing Dr. Vegapunk, with a picture of him in Gear Fifth being used in the paper. Interestingly, Robin notices an “X” mark on his arm, which she did not notice him having when he changes into his awakened form. Also, while the image of Luffy is blurry, the mark is very clear, but the group decides not to worry about it despite its familiarity to Robin.

Dorry and Brogy are impressed that Luffy is now on the same level as Shanks, and express pride that Hajrudin has sworn loyalty to him, even revealing that he is the son of the king of Elbaph. They also reveal that he personally wanted to come and save the Straw Hats, but Dorry and Brogy’s seniority beat him out. The giants do admit there is trouble in Elbaph currently, to the crew’s surprise.

The Giants explain that long ago, Elbaph had a prince who they called the “Accursed Prince”. According to them he devoted himself to darkness and was crucified, and when he attempted to escape Elbaph, everyone worked together to subdue him. Jinbe begins suspecting the prince’s name as the Giants continue, revealing that he killed his own father, King Harald, in order to acquire a Devil Fruit that had been passed down among the royal family, and that if he ever escapes imprisonment, it will be the end of Elbaph.

Sure enough, the prince the Giants were talking about was Loki, who Luffy ends up finding after leaving the group, the former’s intense Haki being what Luffy sensed. Loki senses Luffy despite his eyes being blindfolded and has him introduce himself, which Luffy does. Luffy asks where they are and who he is, and Loki says they are in Elbaph, which he calls the land where wars come from. He also introduces himself as the Sun God who will bring about the end of the world.

Quick References[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • Aboard the Great Eirik, the Straw Hat Pirates decided to halt the search for the Thousand Sunny and head to Elbaph, where they hope to reunite with Luffy's group.
  • After escaping the Land of Gods, Luffy's group crosses a bridge, but Luffy mentions he hears a voice calling out from the forest below and jumps down.
  • The newspaper reports the Egghead Incident, stating the following:
    • The Straw Hats attacked the island with the help of the Giant Warrior Pirates.
      • Dorry and Brogy's bounties have been reactivated with their pictures updated and raised to 1.8 billion each.
    • Luffy killed Vegapunk.
    • Robin notices a familiar "X" on Luffy's arm in the photo in the newspaper, but cannot quite identify it.
  • Brogy and Kashii reveal information about Hajrudin.
    • He volunteered to come to the Straw Hats' aid on Egghead, but had prior commitments.
    • He is revealed to be a prince of Elbaph.
  • The Giant Warrior Pirates reveal information about Loki.
    • Loki is imprisoned for killing his father, king Harald, and stealing a legendary Devil Fruit that was passed down the royal family.
    • He was defeated by the entire might of Elbaph's warriors.
    • He is now dubbed "the Accursed Prince".
  • Gerd and Goldberg approach from the bridge outside the Land of Gods, as Gerd's pet owl Piper told her that Road abducted yet another ship.
    • Gerd greatly dislikes Road and plans to report him to Elder Jarul.
    • Nami overhears and misinterprets Gerd and Goldberg's conversation, and thinks the giants are looking for intruders to capture.
  • Luffy encounters a chained up Loki, who reveals they are indeed on Elbaph.
    • Loki claims to be the Sun God who will bring an end to this world.

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


To relax after finishing the chapter, I started watching the morning drama show Omusubi. Love their catchphrase "Taberi!" It’s so cheerful!


原稿明けのほっこりタイムに朝ドラ「おむすび」観始めた。「食べり！」明るくていい～

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by VIZ Media. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.

[[Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage]], Vol. 17: "Sword got stolen during naptime"

==Short Summary==

Meanwhile, the other crew members are exploring when they learn they are in Elbaph. While crossing a giant bridge, [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] hears a [[Haki/Observation Haki|voice]] and goes after it. As [[Franky]]'s group learn that [[Hajrudin]] is a prince, and about the accursed prince [[Loki]]. On Elbaph, Luffy meets Loki.

==Long Summary==
On the [[Great Eirik]], [[Franky]] tells the [[Giants]] to cease the search for [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy’s]] group, as he is confident that despite them not being here, they are still alive. [[Nico Robin|Robin]] adds that they have done all they can do for now so they should just head for [[Elbaph]] and wait for them. Speaking of Luffy’s group, the six of them managed to escape the room, where they see a giant tree and several giant snowy mountains, with a large rope bridge connecting the castle they were just in to another location upwards. They see two giants crossing the bridge, who turn out to be [[Gerd]] and [[Goldberg]], the respective [[doctor]] and [[cook]] of the [[New Giant Warrior Pirates]]. Gerd asks Goldberg why [[Hajrudin]] let [[Road]] into their crew, with Goldberg saying it is because he is a good [[navigator]]. Gerd, however, expresses her dislike of Road, saying that while [[Loki]] is the “Shame of Elbaph”, she thinks Road deserves that title more, with Goldberg agreeing with her.

Gerd asks her owl, [[Piper]], if she saw Road’s [[Muginn|crow]] carrying a [[Thousand Sunny|ship]] to the castle, which she confirms. Goldberg says they are supposed to arrest intruders, but Road keeps smuggling them into the country, to which if they find them, they will report to [[Jarul]]. Meanwhile, Luffy’s group hides from the two, and [[Usopp]] deduces from their conversation that they have indeed reached Elbaph. Luffy prepares to call out to them but [[Nami]] stops him out of fear that they will consider them intruders. Gerd and Goldberg turn to where the crew was when they hear something but they see nothing, so they continue to the castle.

The [[Straw Hat Pirates|Straw Hats]] continue to walk on the rope bridge, though they try to be careful because there are giant wolves below. Luffy, however, senses something that gives him goosebumps. He tells everyone he heard something back in the diorama and he decides to go on ahead to check it out.

Back out at sea, the [[Giant Warrior Pirates]] are shocked to learn that the [[Newspaper|papers]] are reporting them as the attackers of [[Egghead]]. In addition, [[Dorry]] and [[Brogy|Brogy’s]] [[bounties]] have both jumped up to 1,800,000,000 [[Belly]], even though the both of them do not consider themselves back. Also, Luffy is being blamed for killing [[Vegapunk|Dr. Vegapunk]], with a picture of him in [[Gomu Gomu no Mi/Gear 5 Techniques|Gear Fifth]] being used in the paper. The Giants explain that long ago, Elbaph had a prince who they called the “Accursed Prince”. According to them he devoted himself to darkness and was crucified, and when he attempted to escape Elbaph, everyone worked together to subdue him. Jinbe begins suspecting the prince’s name as the Giants continue, revealing that he killed his own father, [[King (Title)|King]] [[Harald]], in order to acquire a [[Devil Fruit]] that had been passed down among the [[royal]] family, and that if he ever escapes imprisonment, it will be the end of Elbaph.

Loki senses Luffy despite his eyes being blindfolded and has him introduce himself, which Luffy does. He also introduces himself as the Sun God who will bring about the end of the [[world]].
